metadata.dc:description: Disorders of the musculoskeletal system are very prevalent in our society, especially those involving muscles and tendons, above all related to sports and work. These conditions are normally diagnosed and treated according to their clinical symptoms and signs, but a precise diagnosis is often necessary. The most widely used techniques for diagnosing these conditions are ultrasonography and magnetic resonance imaging. In this article, we propose ultrasonography as the technique of choice for diagnosing the most prevalent musculotendinous diseases, because it is accurate, versatile, dynamic, and effective.
